column4: how do I change the screen brightness?  I am using Ubuntu 8.04.
do your laptop brightness keys work?
no.  it used to use the "Fn" key when I had windows but now that key combination doesn't do anything.
did you check if the laptop is supported? google for the name in the ubuntu wiki
should I also include the model number in my search?  or is "sony vaio laptop" good enough?
no you need to include especially the model number
they make a lot of laptops ;)
ok I did both, and my model isn't in there.  but there is one model number that is close.  mine is "PCG-K45" and there is an entry for "PCG-K23"
im not really up to speed on how backlights work, but if you have an ati card you can also set the brightness through atitool or aticonfig something
I do have ati, but I don't use their proprietary driver because I have problems with it, so I don't think aticonfig works
there's also another tool that works with the opensource drivers
named something similarly
would it be installed already or do I have to manually get it?
dont think it comes installed by default, but it's in the repo i think
well how does brightness changing normally work... I don't see a shortcut for it in the "keyboard shortcuts" for my system.
it's a system function iirc, which is why it's not bound to normal keys. I dont think you can bind to FN-keys either

well is there any way to change screen brightness without using the keyboard?  it seems like there should be a way, because if my laptop switches to battery power the screen dims the brightness, so it is capable, I think.
well at least that is working, the dimming is performed by the gnome-power-manager, you can fiddle with that by right clicking on the battery icon in the taskbar
under gutsy that's how I used to change the brightness, but it seems in hardy that they removed the brightness slider..  :(
well you can disable the dimming
true, I guess that will have to do.  Thank you for your help
but other then adjusting it through the console tool i have no idea to how to get the fn keys working
